name: Lunch Celebration for CookUnity's Launch
description:
To celebrate its Canadian debut, CookUnity is inviting Torontonians to experience a chef-crafted meal to-go! 

You're invited to stop by and take home a fresh, restaurant-quality meal crafted by award-winning chefs, including Patrick Kriss of Alo, Trevor Lui of Highbell Hospitality Group, Sand Tsoi of Baan Thai Family, and Dadrian Coke of Chubby's Jamaican Kitchen. While supplies last!

name: First LEGO League Tryouts
description:
Do you have a passion for coding and robotics? Are you a creative problem-solver and builder? Do you want to gain valuable experience in teamwork, presentation skills, and project management? Join our inaugural LEGO League club! 

Suitable for children ages 10-14 years.

name: Indie Pop Grunge with Jon Cohen
description: Fantasy prom king, master crafter of cult-pop gems and multi-threat instrumentalist Jon Cohen Experimental creates sweet but potent stories that spring from curiosity. This dynamic one-man band's a beguiling art rock inventions and melodic hooks promise a sultry escape from those pesky workaday hang-ups. At times folksy, indie and at times grungy, his E.L.O vs. 90's vibe is raw and unapologetic.

name: Estonian Music Week 2025: Vox Clamantis
description:
The Grammy-winning vocal ensemble brings their mastery of Gregorian chant and contemporary compositions with a special program featuring works by Arvo Pärt in celebration of his 90th birthday. As well as the anniversary of Lembit Avesson (100) and Veljo Tormis (95).

Formed in 1996, ensemble Vox Clamantis comprises a diversity of musicians – singers, composers, instrumentalists, and conductors – who have a common interest in the Gregorian chant.

This event is part of the Estonian Music Week (EMW) festival programme running May 22-25.

name: Jr. Forest Explorers: Numbers and Letters
description:
Join us for a caregiver and toddler nature program. Connect with the natural world through hands-on outdoor activities.

Numbers and letters: Explore numbers and letters through a variety of exciting activities.

Sibling policy: This program is for children 18 months to three-and-a-half years old. Children up to age four are welcome if they have not started school (i.e. those entering JK in fall 2023 who are four-years-old are welcome). Please contact us directly for specific inquiries about bringing a child outside the age range. Thank you for your cooperation.

name: Co-Founder Connect With BEA & Yspace
description: Co-founder Connect, presented by the Black Entrepreneurship Alliance in partnership with YSpace — an evening designed to help founders, builders, and innovators find the right partners to strengthen their ventures. ​Whether you're looking for technical expertise, business strategy support, or a complementary co-founder to take your startup to the next level, this is your chance to pitch, connect, and build powerful collaborations. ​

name: Art Hive
description:
Forget about writer's block with this week's Art Hive! Inspired by MOCA's current exhibitions, you're invited to wrestle with words; erasing, revealing and creating new meaning through blackout poetry. Transform everyday found text into surreal prose or poetry, unveiling different meanings and new points of view.

All art materials will be provided. 

Please note: For this Art Hive, enter through the back (by Forno Cultura) and use the elevator to access Floor 3. Art Hive takes place on Mondays, outside of MOCA's regular hours. Seating is limited to 50 people and is on a first-come first-serve basis. Stop by and explore your creative side!
